intro: Hieracium trebevicianum subsp. zljebense, commonly known as the Zljeben hairy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellowish to reddish composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has basal and stem leaves that are usually hairy and lanceolate in shape. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct morphological and genetic features compared to other members of the Hieracium genus.
